verses.roman:
dvivido 'pi mahā-vīryaḥ
śālam udyamya pāṇinā
abhyetya tarasā tena
balaṁ mūrdhany atāḍayat

synonyms: dvividaḥ—Dvivida; api—also; mahā—great; vīryaḥ—whose potency; śālam—a śāla tree; udyamya—lifting up; pāṇinā—with his hand; abhyetya—approaching; tarasā—swiftly; tena—with it; balam—Lord Balarāma; mūrdhani—on the head; atāḍayat—he struck.
translation: Mighty Dvivida also came forward to do battle. Uprooting a śāla tree with one hand, he rushed toward Balarāma and struck Him on the head with the tree trunk.
